citations.desc: Primary conveyances (motor vehicle, rail, air, and marine).
citations.narrative:
The primary conveyance used to transport animals from the local animal shelter to this facility is not being maintained in a
manner that ensures their safety and comfort. The van being used as the primary conveyance has a damaged lock
mechanism preventing the two back doors from securely closing. The facility is currently using a ratchet strap from the
inside of the cabin in an attempt to keep the doors closed. The attending veterinarian confirmed that this vehicle was used
to transport animals in its current condition.
The condition of the vehicle prevents the back doors from being securely closed which could result in the doors opening
while the vehicle is in motion causing stress and possible harm to the animals during transportation. Doors that are not
securely shut may not prevent an animal or primary enclosure from falling out of a moving vehicle and could also allow
the animals to escape the cabin of the primary conveyance. The doors not being securely closed with a proper seal may
also allow engine exhaust fumes from the primary conveyance to enter the cabin which could be harmful to the animals
inside.
The facility must ensure that the animal cargo space of the primary conveyance used to transport dogs and cats must be
designed, constructed, and maintained in a manner that at all times protects the health and well-being of the animals
transported in them, ensures their safety and comfort, and prevents the entry of the engine exhaust from the primary
conveyance during transportation.
Correct by 24 June 2025 or prior to use for transporting animals whichever comes first.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n
